name: PopED lite

screenshots.caption: Step2: Provide the best guess of the model parameters
Step3: Specify the experimental design constraints
Step5: Inspect the Optimised Experimental Design

short_description:
In order to maximise model based understanding of pharmacokinetic-pharmacodynamic (PKPD) studies, it is essential to choose sensible dosages and sampling times for experiments. PopED lite can help you improve your experimental design by algorithmically searching through possible experimental designs and suggesting the optimal experimental design.

The algorithm is based on mathematically sound optimal design theory; however, PopED lite is made for users without any background in optimal design or mathematics. Many of the most common models used for preclinical PKPD experiments are precoded and all you need to do is to choose the model and give some specification of the experiment you are running.

This optimal design software is optimised for the preclinical experimental workflow in the pharmaceutical industry. By following five simple steps clearly outlined in the graphical user interface, you can create a report of the optimised experiment specification in a matter of ten minutes
summary: Simple, Fast, Intuitive optimal design software for preclin PKPD study
